result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek L. Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Derek L. Cook appeared. Court called at 11:10 a.m.  State files an amended Information.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 (Possession of THC).  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 (Possession of THC).  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Court costs of $250.00 with 60 DTP
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-05-2015 11:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Derek L. Cook appeared.  Court called at 3:15 a.m.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  DE does not appear.  Court issues a bench warrant - stayed until 11/05/15 @ 11:00 a.m.  Court adjourned at 3:17 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-16-2015 03:00 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Derek L. Cook appeared.  Court called.  Set for Motion Hearing.  S/T of Investigator James Haefner of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Minser.  Cross by Attorney Chapman.  DE - Ex. 1 (Photo) O/R.  Re-direct by Attorney Minser. Re-cross by Attorney Chapman.  Witness excused.   Attorneys make argument.  Court denies the Motion.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 4:09 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing at 09-25-2015 03:15 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Derek L. Cook appeared.  Court recalled at 10:56 a.m.   DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty.  Bail is continued.  Set out for a PTC.  Court adjourned at 10:58 a.m. lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Derek L. Cook appeared.  Court called at 10:54 a.m. Set for Preliminary Hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver Form. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court adjourned at 10:56 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.


Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
